entry.title: Alfa Romeo Giulietta 1300 Sprint in fully restored condition, with sunr Coupé 1965
entry.model_type: 1300 Sprint in fully restored condition, with sunr
entry.summary: Waanzinnig mooie Alfa Romeo Giulietta 1300 sprint coupe. In 1965 in Italie geleverd en sinds 1970 in Nederland. Tot 1980 is de auto op de weg geweest en daarna in een schuur beland. Dankzij de in 1970 professioneel uitgevoerde anti-roest behandeling zéér goed bewaard gebleven. Meer dan 30 jaar later weer bovenwater gekomen als ‘’barnfind’’ en volledig tot in detail gerestaureerd. Dit was een bare-metal (blank-metaal) restauratie uitgevoerd in Nederland. Voorzien van een uiterst zeldzaam schuifdak! Tijdens de restauratie is besloten de auto te voorzien van een uit 1972 afkomstige Giulia Super 1300 motor en vijfversnellingsbak. Deze zijn beide geheel en tot in de puntjes gereviseerd. Wat heeft geresulteerd in een perfect werkend en rijdende Giulietta Sprint. De originele motor en versnellingsbak zijn erbij. De carrosserie verkeerd in een uitmuntende conditie, de passingen van het plaatwerk zijn goed en het lakwerk is prachtig. Van binnen voorzien van een origineel zwart skai-interieur met donkerblauw tapijt. Zeer uitgebreid restauratieverslag ter inzage aanwezig. Subliem mooie Alfa Sprint coupe met een unieke historie!

entry.title: Alfa Romeo Giulietta sprint VELOCE special series, one of only 101 made Coupé 1959
entry.model_type: sprint VELOCE special series, one of only 101 made
entry.summary: Alfa Romeo Giulietta Sprint Veloce model year 1960 in an excellent condition !! This is a very special Giulietta Sprint Veloce with a limited edition of only 101 pieces! Comes from third owner. Delivered new in America and since the early 90's in the Netherlands. A few years ago is this Sprint Veloce completely ‘’bare metal‘’ restored and technically overhauled into every detail. The condition before the restoration was perfect as well. It still has 80% of its original sheet metal. The car was in such good condition that only the floor of the trunk needed some attention. The body is tight with beautiful thin paint and perfect panel fittings. It has a very nice interior with all original details. Technically perfect so works and drives great! This car is a special one of a small series. Below a small explanation: After the summer break in 1959, the 101 engine was introduced and from that moment all Giulietta's have been made with this new engine. For Sprints was the first 101 engine number AR1315 * 20001 *. From September 1959, however, there was no Sprint and Spider Veloce produced because apparently the 101 Veloce engine was not yet ready for production. Probably under pressure from Hoffman was a small series Sprint and Spider Veloces from January 1960 built for the US market which were equipped with the "old" 750 Veloce engine. For the Sprint Veloce are the chassis numbers AR1493 * 11001 * t / m * 11 101 *, so there are only 101 pieces and for the Spider Veloce are the chassis numbers AR1493 * 07501 * t / m * 07612 *, so 112 pieces. The numbers of the engines for these cars are the same as the 750 Veloces model year 1959. This is a unique car, one of the 101 units built with a proper engine! Only in May 1960 were the first Veloces of type 106 delivered which were based on the 101 engine. This is model number 750, in September they started with the 101 model number. Over 350 Classic and sportscars in stock. More information and photos on www.thegallerybrummen.nl. Or contact us by phone: 0031-575-564055

entry.title: ASA 1000 GT Coupe Ex President of ASA register, full history from ne Coupé 1965
entry.model_type: Ex President of ASA register, full history from ne
entry.summary: It was to Sicily, and more precisely to the town of Catania, that this ASA 1000 GT was delivered new, to Francesco Bondi. In 2004, it passed into the hands of the current owner, none other than the President of the International ASA register, the only recognised club for the marque. A passionate ASA enthusiast, he worked for a long time for the Nora family. It was this family who created the marque Autocostruzioni Società per Azioni, ASA, to produce the Bertone 1000, a model derived from the Ferrarina 854 developed by Ferrari. The engine is in fact a " slice " of the V12 engine of the 250 GT : four-cylinders that produced 97 bhp at 7000 rpm, and as the car only weighed 780 kg, it was capable of 190 km/h. As an engineer, the owner was closely involved in the amazing ASA adventure, knowing all the key personalities. As head of the club, he has regularly helped marque enthusiasts in the research and restoration of their cars. He was therefore extremely well qualified to restore his own car, seeking out the best craftsmen in Milan to carry out a restoration that approached perfection. The result is splendid, with not the slightest detail left to chance, right down to period accessories such as the boot-straps holding the jack in place and the SNAP exhaust tips. The green livery complements perfectly the restrained and concise styling of this little coupé, and the biscuit-coloured upholstery is impeccable. The compact interior has a sporty feel worthy of a big GT car, with its three-spoke wooden steering wheel and dashboard boasting six instruments positioned neatly in front of the driver. The vigour and tone of its small four-cylinder - original - engine suggests a much larger engine and, on a test-drive in the streets of Milan, we were able to verify its lively acceleration. After its restoration, the car was the subject of an eight-page article in the April 2008 edition of Automobilismo d'Epoca. It has ASI certification and comes with the Commissione Sportiva Automobilista Italiana and the Uso e Manutenzione manual. This car, in superb condition and with a wonderful provenance represents a rare opportunity to acquire one of the most fascinating small sports cars of the 1960s. Not only for its history, but also for its engineering and the outstanding personality of this petite GT.Chassis n° ASA100*01180 Engine n° 173/115 - Superb presentation - Property of ASA Italy club president - Original engine - Fascinating model, historically and technically - President of ASA register's personal car Over 350 Classic and sportscars in stock. More information and photos on www.thegallerybrummen.nl. Or contact us by phone: 0031-575-564055

entry.title: Jaguar SS100 Cabriolet 1936
entry.summary: Jaguar SS100 2.5 This is a beautifully car based on correct SS chassis (Saloon basis and even so authentic 2663 cc SS engine! Fabricated regardless of costs by well reputed SS100 connoisseur named “Jim Marland, known for his Proteus C-types!). The complete production was completed in 1994, only 6000 Miles since! All Aluminium body with attention into the smallest details for perfection! Even the specialist cannot see the difference with an original one! The SS100 is considered by classic car enthusiasts as one of the ultimate collector’s item. It is indeed a fact that for the prewar period the combination of the very elegant lines designed by Jaguar patron William Lyons together with the by engineer Harry Weslake intelligently upgraded Standard 6 cylinder engine resulted in a stunning Sportscar. Nowadays these sought after Sportscars have often been copied, as a tribute to the original thing. Sometimes in fiberglass with modern XJ engines... Not many tried to execute an accurate copy using original components, as is the case with this SS100 That is why for this SS100 we can state: As close as you can get to the real thing... but at 1/2 the price!

entry.title: Lincoln KA V12 Short Wheel Base Sedan Sedan 1934
entry.model: KA V12 Short Wheel Base Sedan
entry.summary: This is the rare short wheelbase version 136”. In 1934 Lincoln decided to fit the big V12 to both KA and KB series, leaving only the wheelbase as a difference between both types. In previous years the KA had a smaller V12, the 125 hp where the KB was fitted with the 150 hp block. In 1934 this policy was changed. This sporty looking sedan, with division, is totally complete and in lovely condition, believed to have original paintwork, green/gray metallic (a factory extra) over black with pink wheels and striping. It has the remarkable outfit of front side windows which can move both vertical and horizontal. A good runner and a strong performer with the 6,8 litre V12 engine.The car has been imported into Holland some 30 years ago and has been part of a well known collection. It comes with Dutch registration. Chassis number; KA 2860, Engine number; KA 2860, Series 521, type number; 525, Body number 1-395 by Murray Body Corp., Detroit, Mich.

entry.title: MG J2 RHD Cabriolet 1934
entry.summary: Beautiful and very special MG J2! Completely restored and overhauled in the period of 1970-1975. The Dutch owner has kept it then in his private collection, and took care of it with all the love, and was the owner for more than 40 years. Only driven 53 miles in 40 years ! The result is that this MG now still looks like it was restored only a year ago. The beautiful 30's blue is the original color of this MG, which is very rare because most were red and green at that time. The restoration itself is done with the most precision, and to originality. The whole history with many invoices and documentation are of course present at this stunning car! Really a beauty in an exceptional condition!

entry.title: MG TA Cabriolet 1938
entry.summary: This MG TA is in an exceptional good condition. The stunning TA was restored and technically overhauled some years ago in Germany into the last detail. The MG has been restored in typical German way with attention to every detail and originality. The paint is nice and very well sprayed. The leather interior is new. The combination of the grey paint with red interior is very beautiful. The chassis and body are provided with transparent wax. Everything about this car is functioning as it once was meant. The revised engine runs very nice and the gearbox switches well. The previous owner has installed an un-sprayed aluminum bonnet which gives the car just something extra. Of course, the original bonnet is present. The convertible roof is new. Many invoices are available and even the original first German papers are present. Finally, we can speak of a unique MG TA! It will not surprise you that driving this car is a magnificent experience.

entry.title: Monteverdi Sierra 5.2 V8 Sedan 1978
entry.summary:
Unique and very special sedan of the Swiss manufacturer Monteverdi, this extremely rare "Sierra". Monteverdi has produced only 20 – 50 cars of this type! Actually no one knows the exact production numbers. Monteverdi has never released the exact production numbers of all models. This Sierra is built on the basis of the Plymouth Volaré, and there are also several materials from other car manufacturers such as Fiat, Renault and BMW used to this luxury sedan to give it its own face. After a few years of production Monteverdi stopped the production of these hand-built car. The name "Sierra" Monteverdi sold to the car giant Ford with the agreement that Monteverdi would get for each produced for Ford Sierra 5 Swiss Francs . As you know, the Ford Sierra was a great success, and this has Monteverdi brought 13 million francs! Only a few people know that the first "Sierra" was a Monteverdi. The car offered by us is in a beautiful and well maintained condition. A nice and solid body with nice paintwork. All the details are still the original, even the beautiful leather interior. Technically equipped with a 5.2 V8, and an automatic transmission giving the car great performances! For the collector and enthusiast, this is a unique chance to add this model of this exclusive Swiss manufacturer to her/his collection! Also as an investment very interesting! Over 350 Classic and sportscars in stock. More information and photos on www.thegallerybrummen.nl. Or contact us by phone: 0031-575-564055
THIS VEHICLE IS IN OUR STORAGE, VIEWING BY APPOINTMENT ONLY.

entry.title: Morgan 4/4 1600 Cabriolet 1968
entry.summary: The Morgan 4/4 (series 1) was first introduced in 1936 by the Morgan Motor Company. This example, built in September 1968, concerns a 4/4 1600 and, looking at the chassis nr., this was the 23th that was built. This original European first delivered car was completely restored by a dutch specialist called Lowland Classics. The quality of this restoration is amazing. It was done ‘bare metal’ and with a great eye for detail. Next to the fantastic restoration of the chassis and the body, the Morgan has been completely overhauled technically. Therefore the car runs and drives as new. The interior was also put together with great care. Since the year 2000 the Morgan has been in the possession of the last (and only) Dutch owner. A beautiful Morgan 4/4 1600 in a great overall condition.

entry.title: Porsche 356 B 1600 S Karmann Notchback coupe one of only 600, this one Coupé 1962
entry.model_type: Karmann Notchback coupe one of only 600, this one
entry.summary: Beautiful and rare 356 T6 'Notch Back' coupe. Delivered new in California, USA. This is an original Karmann Notchback coupe of the second production phase (T6) This means that he was born as a coupe. So it ISN’T a convertible with welded hard-top. The T6 has a totally different design and it is recognizable by its beautiful arched window frames, larger back window and double grill above the engine compartment. They have been in production for only two years and there are only 600 produced! According to its chassis number it is the second last one that is made. The body is in a wonderful condition, stainless, panel fittings are perfect and the paintwork is beautiful. Equipped with a great wine red interior with incredibly beautiful patina. Thanks to the unique design, low production numbers a very interesting investment with a high collectable value.

entry.title: Porsche 911 996 R one of only 15 made, limited edition Coupé 2005
entry.model_type: 996 R one of only 15 made, limited edition
entry.summary: Unique version, only delivered in the Netherlands. Beautiful Porsche 996 R in basaltblack. PON, the famous Porsche import company made in cooperation with the factory a special version of the 911 Carrera coupe called a 996 R, to celebrate The European Road Transport show in 2003. Approximately there are only made 15 !! This copy is always dealer maintained and has just 125.000 KM experience. Offers a comprehensive history incl. many invoices and stamped service books. Compared to the normal 911 Carrera, the Carrera R standard has the following options: more power (345PK) with modified cylinder heads, camshafts, inlet / outlet manifolds and updated engine software, sports suspension 10mm lower, Porsche stability management, 18 '' wheels turbolook type 2, in / switchable sports exhaust system, Porsche HiFi kit, silver Carrera R logo, sports seats lowered by 10mm, black leather lined and Porsche Crest embossed on the headrests. 996 Porsches in such condition are rare. Very interesting investment!

entry.title: Porsche 911 Carrera 3.0 WTL ONE-OFF, Porsche certificate, matc Targa 1977
entry.model_type: Carrera 3.0 WTL ONE-OFF, Porsche certificate, matc
entry.summary: Unique, this Porsche 911 Carrera 3.0 Works Turbo Look !! Specially built for one of the largest Porsche dealers in Germany at that time, Glöckler Frankfurt. The code for this extension was described by Porsche as Nr 451. This is, of course, certified with the original "Porsche Zertifikat". The 911 Targa Carrera 3.0 is already without this expansion quite rare, and through this factory expansion an absolute "One-off"! The so-called "Werks Turbo Look" versions started by Porsche in 1984 in their program. This WTL is from 1977, and was possibly the inspiration for the later production WTL. Some years ago full body-off restored and overhauled according to the indicated values of the birth certificate. For the collector, and investor a unique chance!! THIS VEHICLE IS IN OUR STORAGE, VIEWING BY APPOINTMENT ONLY.

entry.title: Rolls-Royce Phantom II Boat-Tail Ex. Prince Pratap Singhrao Gaekwad, F Cabriolet 1929
entry.model_type: II Boat-Tail Ex. Prince Pratap Singhrao Gaekwad, F
entry.summary: First owner: Prince, Pratap Singhrao Gaekwad (1908 –1968) the 13th Maharaja of Baroda. As Best Car in the World The Phantom II was a worthy successor to the Silver Ghost and the New Phantom. A total of 1767 Phantom II chassis were built between 1929 and 1935. These were all commissioned by the buyers, to taste, with renowned coach builders and under the auspices of Rolls Royce Ltd, equipped with special bodywork. The history of this real globetrotter Phantom II chassis number 70WJ is fully known and documented. In September 1929 the rolling chassis was delivered by coachbuilder Barker to be equipped with an "Open Tourer coachwork. Upon completion, the car was shipped on January 10 1930 from Liverpool on the SS Brittania to Bombay, where the local Rolls-Royce dealer delivered the Phantom II to its first owner, the 21 year old Prince Pratap Singhrao, whom used the car for hunting tigers. Several photos illustrate this period in India. In 1934 the Phantom II was sold to Mr. Keith Williams living in London, which mainly used the car to drive to his country house in Brighton. In 1940 Mr. N. Gordon (also in London) bought the Phantom II and had owned it up to May 1967 when Mr. John Smart, who lived in Llorret de Mar (Spain) transported the car to Spain. Over there, near Gerona, about fifty years ago, the renowned company 'Carrocerias Vert (source Andre Blaize), carried out a partial conversion of the original, some heavy-looking, Barker-carriage in to a body with a - in beauty -Elegant "Boat Tail" design. Josep Vert, who specialized as a bodybuilder of exclusive cars (i.o. 22 converted Rolls Royce's, 3 Bentley's and 16 Hispana-Suiza's from his hand) has the now presented Phantom II chassis number 70WJ also made by a partial conversion prettier and more attractive compared to the initially supplied Barker coach. Immediately after the body technical intervention by Josep Vert, the Phantom II was purchased in 1968 by Thomas Watson jr. in Connecticut (USA) who gave the car to his brother Arthur for its 20th wedding anniversary! The Phantom II remained until 1994 within the same family Watson. For you as additional information: the Watson family owned IBM. Thomas J. Watson jr. was beside CEO of IBM also ambassador to the US in the Soviet Union. His brother Arthur K. Watson (Dick for friends) was responsible for the international expansion of IBM World Trade Corporation. Arthur was later the US ambassador to France and was the first liaison officer between the US and China. At Yale University in New Haven there is a building named after him (the Arthur K. Watson Hall). The Watson family belonged to the US's most influential families and moved in the circles of the Rockefeller and the Kennedys. Through mediation in Rolls-Royce circles well known John Fasal (he was, among other, author of the book "The Maharaja's Rolls Royce's) the Phantom II chassis number 70WJ arrived in 1994 back to England to be included in the Ashdown Collection. The Rolls-Royce has during this period the English registration JX2851. Until 2010 the car remained in the collection and ended up with the current owner through an auction. Since 2010, the car is fully recommissioned . The engine is a overhauled for a small fortune by a renowned specialist, pistons, clutch, camshaft and cylinder head are renewed. This also applies to the radiator, the nickel work (performed by Derby Plating in the UK) and the Vacuum pump. The car is returned to its original color "New Ivory” and " Mandeville Blue” (lavender) as then delivered to the 13th Maharaja of Baroda and is "fully ready to go. In summary, a breathtaking beautiful Rolls Royce Phantom II from the Roaring Twenties of the last century now offered, which is fully documented. Also, a set of factory documents anno 1929 Rolls-Royce completes the history file. The Phantom II is now at the Gallery in Brummen and you are welcome to come and see her and experience. For you a significant opportunity to invest in terms of history and state of health in an excellent Rolls-Royce Phantom II with an Open Boat Tail Tourer body which the English so aptly called a 'Head Turner. Pre- owners: Januari - maart 1930 Rolls Royce factory showcar in India, Maart 1930 – 1934 Prince Maharaja of Baroda, 1934 – 1940 Keith Williams London - Brighton, 1940 – 1967 N. Gordon – London, 1967 John Smart > boat tail conversion at Josep Vert in Gerona Spain, 1968 – 1994 Familie Watson USA IBM owners, 1994 – 2010 Ashdown collection UK, 2010 – 2014 Rupert Blijlevens NL. Over 350 Classic and sportscars in stock. More information and photos on www.thegallerybrummen.nl. Or contact us by phone: 0031-575-564055
